snippet: During Wednesday’s presidential debate, Mitt Romney used striking new language to describe his policy proposals in ways that may be sowing confusion about how he would govern.
abstract: Mitt Romney, during the first presidential debate with Pres Obama, pivots politically from a severely conservative stance to one that is more moderate, seeking to appeal to more centrist general election voters; change in his language from speeches he made during the primaries may be intended to assuage independent voters, but it may also be sowing confusion about how he would govern.

byline.original: By MICHAEL COOPER, DAVID KOCIENIEWSKI and JACKIE CALMES

lead_paragraph: During Wednesday’s presidential debate, Mitt Romney used striking new language to describe his policy proposals in ways that may be sowing confusion about how he would govern.

headline.main: Entering Stage Right, Romney Moved to Center
headline.print_headline: Entering Stage Right, Romney Moved to Center
